channel.title: Area attacks/heal
channel.description:
Could anyone explain how I would add an area attack/heal. I'm interested in making an admins-only command that will heal everyone around you or cause them damage. So really, I'm looking for two seperate commands. Can anyone help me?
Many Thanks,
Syrillia.

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

yep

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Thanks! That works! So if I change the + to a -, it will do damage. But how do I get it to do the emote on each person? I could get it to do the emote on myself, but what about everyone that get hits?

*edit

Could I just use this?

public void healArea() {
for (Player players : server.playerHandler.players)
if (players.absY >= absY + 5 || players.absX >= absX - 5 || players.absY <= absY + 5 || players.absX <= absX - 5) {
players.hitDiff += misc.random(24);
startAnimation(1979);
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

ok on those errors, fixing the string will fix it all, so change the players = line to this

for (Player players : server.playerHandler.players)

i got out of web design in my last our of school…too much html in my head =s lol, that will work.
and for attacking players within an area, change

[code]
hitDiff += #;
[/code[
to

hitDiff -= #;

see the difference? hitDiff means hitpoint difference, if its a - it does damage, if its a + it gives u hitpoints…simple; # is the dmg to + or -[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

TY. I’m not really in the right mood to look over the code properly. You know how it could be. At the moment I’m working on adding the Godsword specials now that I’ve done the emotes and stuff. Could you help me with freezing everyone in the area like like ice barrage?’

Ignore that for the minute…

I’m still getting the same errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

change

players.hitDiff += misc.random((playerRights * 10));

to

players.hitDiff += misc.random(#);

and # is the number you want to be between 0-#, the random.
if you dont want a random, just make it

players.hitDiff += #;
[/code[
# being the number healed. I like to throw in randoms, makes it more fun

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Well, nice making up without a reference. If anyone has a server online, could they test it for me? I don’t have a server up, so I cant test it. Do I need to change X1?

Read full topic

item.title: Area attacks/heal
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

make a void.
heres something im making up without reference to anything.

public void healArea() {
string players = X1;
if (players.absY >= absY + 5 || players.absX >= absX - 5 || players.absY <= absY + 5 || players.absX <= absX - 5) {
players.hitDiff += misc.random((playerRights * 10));
}
}

X1 would be the path that specifies all players, would heal a random between 0-10, 0-20, or 0-30 dependant on playerRights, and would heal all within 5 square radius.

Read full topic
